alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 09 at 9:30AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Northeastern Brooks Range. This includes the cities of Anaktuvuk Pass, Atigun Pass, Galbraith Lake, Sagwon, And Franklin Bluffs. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy showers over the Northeastern Brooks Range Friday night through Saturday night dropped between 1.0 and 2.0 inches of rain. Areas between Atigun Pass and Sagwon received up to 3 inches of rain. The heavy rain will fell in a short period of time meaning that creeks and small rivers in steep terrain will high today and could flood. Larger rivers north of the mountains are rising today, and some will likely flood with the water moving downstream today through Monday. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People in the Northeast Brooks Range should be alert to the possibility of rapidly rising water levels along creeks and small rivers in steep terrain through this evening, and along larger rivers further way from the mountains on today through Monday.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
